sharp.description: Use to adjust the curvature of the border corners for an element. Use for sharp corners.

tiny.description: Use to adjust the curvature of the border corners for an element. Use for barely rounded corners.

small.description: Use to adjust the curvature of the border corners for an element. Use for slightly rounded corners, like icon buttons or menus.

medium.description: Use to adjust the curvature of the border corners for an element. Use for moderately rounded corners, like cards.

large.description: Use to adjust the curvature of the border corners for an element. Use for mostly rounded corners, like modals.

pill.description: Use to adjust the curvature of the border corners for an element. Use for corners that are as round as possible, like standard buttons and badges.

default.description: Use as the default border width for dividers.

hover.description: Use as the border width hover state for dividers.

clicked.description: Use as the border width clicked state for dividers.

regular.description: Use as the default border width for elements.

strong.description: Use as a stronger/wider border width for elements.

extra-strong.description: Use as the strongest/widest border width for elements.

default.description: Use as the default border width for containers like cards, panels, code editors, etc.

hover.description: Use as the hover border width for containers like cards, panels, code editors, etc.

clicked.description: Use as the clicked border width for containers like cards, panels, code editors, etc.

default.description: Use as the default border width for containers that convey statuses like inline alerts, notification drawer items and hints. This token is typically paired with status border colors.

read.description: Use as the border width for containers that convey  a “read” status, like notification drawer items.

default.description: Use as the default border width for actions like secondary and tertiary buttons
Use as the default border width for plain actions

hover.description: Use as the border width for plain actions in their hover state

clicked.description: Use as the border width for plain actions in their clicked state

hover.description: Use as the hover state border width for actions like secondary and tertiary buttons

clicked.description: Use as the clicked state border width for actions like secondary and tertiary buttons

default.description: Use as the default border width for controls like text inputs, menu toggles and control buttons

hover.description: Use as the hover state border width for controls like text inputs, menu toggles and control buttons

clicked.description: Use as the clicked state border width for controls like text inputs, menu toggles and control buttons

xs.description: Use for extra small spaces between elements.

sm.description: Use for small spaces between elements.

md.description: Use for medium-sized spaces between elements.

lg.description: Use for large spaces between elements.

xl.description: Use for extra large spaces between elements.

2xl.description: Use for double extra large spaces spacing between elements.

3xl.description: Use for triple extra large spaces between elements.

4xl.description: Use for quadruple extra large spaces between elements.

default.description: Use to set the vertical padding inside of controls. This is used across buttons, text inputs, menu toggles, etc.

compact.description: Use to set the vertical padding inside of  compact controls. This is used across text inputs, menu toggles, control buttons etc.

plain.description: Use to set the vertical padding inside of plain controls, like in plain menu toggles and plain buttons.

spacious.description: Use to set the vertical padding inside a large/display controls. This is used across buttons, text inputs, menu toggles, etc.

default.description: Use to set the horizontal padding inside of controls, like text inputs and menu toggles.

plain.description: Use to set the horizontal padding inside of plain controls, like in plain menu toggles.

compact.description: Use to set the horizontal padding inside of  compact controls. This is used across text inputs, menu toggles, control buttons etc.

spacious.description: Use to set the horizontal padding in large/display controls.

default.description: Use to set the horizontal padding inside a default action, like buttons.
Use to set the horizontal padding inside a plain action, like plain buttons.

compact.description: Use to set the horizontal padding inside a compact, plain action/button.
Use to set the horizontal padding inside a compact action, like compact buttons.

spacious.description: Use to set the horizontal padding inside a large/display action, like CTAs.

default.description: Use to space an element, like an icon or badge, inline with text

compact.description: Use to space an element, like an icon or badge, inline with text

default.description: Use to set the space between controls, like in input groups or filter groups

vertical.description: Use to set the vertical space between items in a group, like a field label, form input, and helper text placed in a vertical/stacked layout

horizontal.description: Use to set the horizontal space between items in a group, like a field label and form input placed in a horizontal layout.

default.description: Use to set the horizontal space between groups of elements, like between multiple action groups or forms groups placed in a horizontal layout.
Use to set the vertical space between groups of elements, like between stacked form groups.
Use to set the space between actions, like in an action list group.

plain.description: Use to set the space between plain actions, like in an action list group.

page-chrome.description: Use to define inner padding for structural elements in order to maintain alignment, like in the masthead, navigation menu, or main page content.

default.description: Use to define gutters between elements in certain layouts, like grids.

2xl.description: Use for double extra large icons.

3xl.description: Use for triple extra large icons.

sm.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with small body text

default.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with default body text

lg.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with large body text

h1.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with first level headings

h2.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with second level headings

h3.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with third level headings

h4.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with fourth level headings

h5.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with fifth level headings

h6.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with sixth level headings

xs.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–xs text

sm.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–sm text

md.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–md text

lg.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–lg text

xl.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–xl text

2xl.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–2xl text

3xl.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–3xl text

4xl.description: Use for icons that are placed inline with font–size–3xl text

default.description: Use to define the default weight for body text

bold.description: Use to define the bold weight for body text, often used to field labels or to add emphasis.

default.description: Use to define the default weight for heading text

bold.description: Use to define the bold weight for heading text, often used to add emphasis.

body.description: Use to define the line height for body text

heading.description: Use to define the line height for heading text

body.description: Use to define the font family for body text

heading.description: Use to define the font family for heading text

mono.description: Use to define the font family for mono text

sm.description: Use for a smaller font size in body sections.

default.description: Use as the default font size in body sections.

lg.description: Use for a larger font size in body sections.

h1.description: Use as the font size for first level headings.

h2.description: Use as the font size for second level headings.

h3.description: Use as the font size for third level headings.

h4.description: Use as the font size for fourth-level headings.

h5.description: Use as the font size for fifth level headings.

h6.description: Use as the font size for sixth level headings.

sm.description: Use as the font size for small text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

md.description: Use as the font size for medium text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

lg.description: Use as the font size for large text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

xl.description: Use as the font size for extra large text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

2xl.description: Use as the font size for double extra large text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

3xl.description: Use as the font size for triple extra large text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

4xl.description: Use as the font size for quadruple extra large text that isn’t a heading or in a body section.

xs.description: Use to set an extra small z-index, to display an element below other elements with a larger z-index. Use for smaller parts of a component that need to overlap adjacent elements, like box shadows of hovered elements.

sm.description: Use to set a small z-index, to display an element above other elements with smaller z-indexes. Use for components that need to appear above surrounding elements, like menus/dropdowns.

md.description: Use to set a medium z-index, to display an element above other elements with smaller z-indexes Use for sticky elements, like banners and page sections.

lg.description: Use to set a large z-index, to display an element above other elements with smaller z-indexes Use for the backdrop component, which appears beneath an open modal.

xl.description: Use to set an extra large z-index, to display an element above other elements with smaller z-indexes. Use for modals.

2xl.description: Use to set a double extra large z-index, to display an element above all other page elements. Use for elements that should appear on top of all others, like toast alert groups.

default.description: Use to define the X value for a default small box-shadow, like in sticky sections

top.description: Use to define the X value for a small box-shadow that appears on the top of a raised element, like in sticky footers

bottom.description: Use to define the X value for a small box-shadow that appears on the bottom of a raised element, like in sticky headers.

left.description: Use to define the X value for a small box-shadow that appears on the left of a raised element, like in sticky columns.

right.description: Use to define the X value for a small box-shadow that appears on the right of a raised element, like in sticky columns.

default.description: Use to define the X value for a default medium box-shadow, used in popovers and raised menus.

top.description: Use to define the X value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the top of a raised element, like in overlay bottom drawers.

bottom.description: Use to define the X value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the bottom of a raised element.

left.description: Use to define the X value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the left of a raised element, like in overlay drawers that show on the right of the screen.

right.description: Use to define the X value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the right of a raised element, like in overlay drawers that show on the left of the screen.

default.description: Use to define the X value for a default large box-shadow, used in modals and wizards.

top.description: Use to define the X value for a large box-shadow that appears on the top of a raised element.

bottom.description: Use to define the X value for a large box-shadow that appears on the bottom of a raised element.

left.description: Use to define the X value for a large box-shadow that appears on the left of a raised element.

right.description: Use to define the X value for a large box-shadow that appears on the right of a raised element.

default.description: Use to define the Y value for a default small box-shadow, like in sticky sections

top.description: Use to define the Y value for a small box-shadow that appears on the top of a raised element, like in sticky footers

bottom.description: Use to define the Y value for a small box-shadow that appears on the bottom of a raised element, like in sticky headers.

left.description: Use to define the Y value for a small box-shadow that appears on the left of a raised element, like in sticky columns.

right.description: Use to define the Y value for a small box-shadow that appears on the right of a raised element, like in sticky columns.

default.description: Use to define the Y value for a default medium box-shadow, used in popovers and raised menus.

top.description: Use to define the Y value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the top of a raised element, like in overlay bottom drawers

bottom.description: Use to define the Y value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the bottom of a raised element.

left.description: Use to define the Y value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the left of a raised element, like in overlay drawers that show on the right of the screen.

right.description: Use to define the Y value for a medium box-shadow that appears on the right of a raised element, like in overlay drawers that show on the left of the screen.

default.description: Use to define the Y value for a default large box-shadow, used in modals and wizards.

top.description: Use to define the Y value for a large box-shadow that appears on the top of a raised element.

bottom.description: Use to define the Y value for a large box-shadow that appears on the bottom of a raised element.

left.description: Use to define the Y value for a large box-shadow that appears on the left of a raised element.

right.description: Use to define the Y value for a large box-shadow that appears on the right of a raised element.

sm.description: Use to define the blur for a small box-shadow

md.description: Use to define the blur for a medium box-shadow

lg.description: Use to define the blue for a large box-shadow

default.description: Use to define the spread for a small box-shadow

directional.description: Use to define the spread for a small box-shadow

default.description: Use to define the spread of a medium box-shadow

directional.description: Use to define the spread of a medium box-shadow

default.description: Use to define the spread of a large box-shadow

directional.description: Use to define the spread of a large box-shadow

xs.description: Use to define an extra small breakpoint, which is the minimum width at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

sm.description: Use to define a small breakpoint, which is the minimum width at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

md.description: Use to define a medium breakpoint, which is the minimum width at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

lg.description: Use to define a large breakpoint, which is the minimum width at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

xl.description: Use to define an extra large breakpoint, which is the minimum width at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

2xl.description: Use to define a double extra large breakpoint, which is the minimum width at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

sm.description: Use to define a small height breakpoint, which is the minimum height at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

md.description: Use to define a medium height breakpoint, which is the minimum height at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

lg.description: Use to define a large height breakpoint, which is the minimum height at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

xl.description: Use to define an extra large height breakpoint, which is the minimum height at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

2xl.description: Use to define an extra small height breakpoint, which is the minimum height at which an effect applies to an element, in order to support responsive design.

offset.description: Use to define the position of a custom focus ring that sits outside (offset) of the element receiving focus.

inset.description: Use to define the position of a custom focus ring that sits inside (inset) of the element receiving focus.

offset.description: Use to define the width of a custom focus ring that sits outside (offset) of the element receiving focus.

inset.description: Use to define the width of a custom focus ring that sits inside (inset) of the element receiving focus.
